docs.text:
SauterSchwabQuadrature.jl  THIS IS JUST A TEST


This package can be used to solve problems of following type:


$$


$$


The above integral is a double area-integral over two triangles 
Γ1
 and 
Γ2
. The integrand consists of two basisfunctions 
b_i(x)
 and 
b_j(y)
 and the kernel 
G(x,y)
.   


This kind of integral often appears in the area of Boundary Element Methods for solving elliptic partial differential equations and can be interpretated as the interaction of the two basisfunctions on their respective triangles.


As the solving algorithm works for a wide range of basisfunctions and kernels, all the conditions for the kernel, basisfunctions and the integration areas will be given:  




Subtitle





\frac{n!}{k!(n - k)!} = \binom{n}{k}







Index




SauterSchwabQuadrature.f




#


SauterSchwabQuadrature.f
 — 
Method
.


f(x) is a super duper cool function

docs.text: This package can be used to solve problems of following type:  $$  $$  The above integral is a double area-integral over two triangles  Γ1  and  Γ2 . The integrand consists of two basisfunctions  b_i(x)  and  b_j(y)  and the kernel  G(x,y) .     This kind of integral often appears in the area of Boundary Element Methods for solving elliptic partial differential equations and can be interpretated as the interaction of the two basisfunctions on their respective triangles.
